venue.address_2: ~~>Pull way in on grass, almost to water
venue.name: Strawberry"s Park (Kayak Put In)

item.description:
Hi Everyone,

It seems like a few of us that were at Rob's Northwest Park event will be at this event too on the next day, its actually a short distance away from the park and is a landmark for travel to the area.

Anyway this is a relaxing, slow, and social paddling event good for recreational and touring kayaks with even more time to socialize at the end at BARTs,
Its about 5 miles with some current downstream.

Whitewater boats are not really good for any of my events since they are not good for distances on any flat water, they are just good for fast currens, WE only raft on those and thats with Crabapple in MA or VT'

Saturday: Sunny, with a high near 73.

Saturday Night: Mostly clear, with a low around 51.

Sunday: Sunny, with a high near 75.

Sunday Night: Partly cloudy, with a low around 54.

Weekend is looking good.

Print the directions, or better yet get a GPS.


WE WILL WAITE TILL THE DAM RELEASE STARTS, USUALLY BY THE TIME WE HAVE MOVED THE CARS AND GET BACK, ITS ON, OR JUST GO WITH WHATEVER WATER FLOW THERE IS.

Its class 1 and then goes to flat water in about 100 yards distance.


Ok getting to Strawberry Park, the put in and meeting place. MEET HERE FIRST.

From Hartford:

take I 91 North to exit # 38,
This is the exit for rte 75.
Take a right off of the exit and go North on rte 75 toward Bradley Airport Direction,
go 2.25 miles, cross the river bridge and the first right is RIVER STREET, take that right, go apx 1,000 feet and the Strawberry Park entrance is on the right..go into the drive way around the little circle, we will be unloading in the grass a bit further down into the park nearer the river via the path..

A FEW OF US MAY BE GOING UPSTREAM TO ANOTHER PUT IN ON NILES ROAD ( jOHN wELCH pARK)... It depends on flow conditions.


Our take out point is behind BARTS Drive In restaurant in the boat ramp area.
This is where we can do a Pot Luck Barbie-Q and also get stuff to eat from BARTS or Dominoes Pizza Place.

ok getting from Strawberry Park to Barts,

We have to move cars..SO PLAN AHEAD.

Leave the park, take a left onto River Street, a left onto rte 75, head toward 91, go under 91 stay on 75 for another 1.25 miles and take a left onto Pleasant Street, (Barts is on the corner of Pleasant and Palisado)

(This June there was construction on Pleasant, so i had to go into the center of town and take a left onto Palasado then left onto Pleasant.) Just keep this in mind. Most likely its finished now and the original directions are fine.


Barts is on the left a short ways after you go under the old rail bridge underpass, pull into the boat ramp lot and we will go back to Strawberry and Welch Parks with just a few cars.

Remember these directions....LOL

Ok bring some food, and other stuff for a short boat trip and get together after..


I only can transport the CANOE, thats good for 4 people on this kind of river trip= Alex, AL, Bill and Kathy G ?

other available Kayaks are:

The Brown Bathtub= Pungo 12'= UNTESTED FOR LEAKS, BUT LOOKS OK= Maybe Jen #2

The Yellow Bananna= Cobra Expidition SOT 18', = UNTESTED FOR LEAKS, SOME HATCH DAMAGE, BUT LOOKS OK= Jennifer

I HAVE NO WAY TO TRANSPORT THESE SO YOU HAVE TO PICK THEM UP.
A DOUGHNATION OF SOMETHING WOULD BE APPRECIATED.. OR GET SOME REAL GOOD FOOD FOR US..LOL



I have enough safety equipment and paddles for the above boats
along with plenty of straps for transport.



ok see you there if you can make it..
al-r



extra stuff IF YOU ARE INTERESTED: ..
PUT-IN : Access Point 30, River Street Boat Launch, Windsor, CT
Directions : From Rt. 20, take Rt. 75 to the Poquonock section of Windsor. In the center of Poquonock at the traffic light, turn left onto River Street. Follow River Street for approximately .3 mile. Turn right into Strawberry Hills Park. During periods of low water, this area can be "scratchy." Better launching times may be around 12:00 p.m. when water is typically released from the reservoir. NOTE: If you wish to run the rapids: In Poquonock, turn right onto Niles Road and continue to Welch Park. At the back of this town park there is a difficult carry to access the river and no formal boat launch.


INTERMITTENT ACCESS POINTS
Access Point 31, Pleasant Street Park, Windsor, CT This asphalt launch ramp is behind Bart?s on Rt. 159, located one mile north from jct. Rt. 75/305/159 in the center of Windsor. Note: Put in here only after 12:00 p.m. Due to the release from the hydro facility upstream, there typically is not enough water to boat here before noon.
item.how_to_find_us: Pull into park, look in the grassy area by river, ORANGE STRIPED CONES & HAT

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: *KAYAK & CANOE* Farmington River, Strawberry Park to BARTS & Barbie-Q at BARTS
